name: Davids Cozy Little Auberge
summary: Es ist eine Private Herberge für junge Leute. Im moment habe ich dort hauptsächlich Flüchtlinge, alle junge Manner aus Syrien und Albanien. Man spricht hier  Arabisch, Albanisch., Deutsch, Engl., Francais & Greek.  Es gibt ein Wohnzimmer und Küche
space: Es handelt sich um ein Zimmer in einer 2 Zimmer Wohnung bei mir im Haus. Das Zimmer gehört meinem Sohn, der allerdings zur Zeit nur etas mehr als die Hälfte des Jahres hier ist.  Ich selbst und mein Freund Andi wohnen auch hier im Haus, eine Etage tiefer.  Das Zimmer ist groß, hat ein Doppelbett, 2 Sessel, 3 kleine Tische, einen Schreibtisch, und 2 Stühle. Zudem Es gibt es dort auch einen Balkon mit Blick auf meinen Garten und meinen Buddha, sowie auf die Moschee gegenüber. Es gibt eine Küche mit einem Tisch unds 2 Stühlen sowuie zahlreichen Kochutensilien. Zudem einen Gasherd Eine Dusche befindet sich in der Küche, wie in den meisten Berliner Altbauwohnungen, von vor 1949. Unser Haus stammt von 1890. name: Schönes Balkonzimmer- nahe Friedrichshain und IGA
summary: Meine Wohnung ist in der Nähe von S41/42- und U-Bahn; in 15 Minuten ist man am Alexanderplatz;....zur Internationalen Gartenausstellung ist es nur eine kurze Fahrt mit der U 5!  Das Haus liegt direkt an einem schönen alten Park! Es ist angenehm ruhig, hell und sonnig. Es gibt auf der kleinen Strasse keinen Durchgangsverkehr !Durch die zentrale Lage ist man schnell im Zentrum von Berlin( z. Bsp.am Gendarmenmarkt oder der Museumsinsel . Das Zimmer  ist gut für Alleinreisende und Paare.

name: be 09 in the Villa!
summary: be 09 in the Villa, located in the Hotel**** Villa Kastania, a family-run hotel with swimming pool, sauna and restaurant. It is possible to have breakfast every morning or use the swimming pool, for an extra charge.
space: be 09 in the Villa, located in the Hotel**** Villa Kastania, a family-run hotel with swimming pool, sauna and restaurant. It is possible to have breakfast every morning or use the swimming pool, for an extra charge. My house is near the Theodor-Heuss-Platz, the Bio Company Reichsstrasse, the main bus station, the fairgrounds and the ICC. You'll love my property because of the environment, the original works of art in the studio apartment and the individual design. In your home, many old and new Berlin books are available, to give you a sense of Berlin. My accommodation is good for couples, unaccompanied adventurers, business travelers, families (with children) and furry friends (pets). The kitchen is small but special and fully equipped, so one can cook. However, it is also possible to have lunch and dinner in the restaurant Marron, located in the Hotel  . We are looking forward to your visit!

name: Mitten im Geschehen in Berlin
space: Kleines, helles  Zimmer (12qm) mit Blick zum begrünten Innenhof in einer ruhig gelegenen Altbauwohnung (120 qm) zu vermieten.  Bad Mitbenutzung. Das Zimmer hat eine Schlafcouch, die für zwei Leute, die's kuschelig mögen, ausreicht, Tisch, Stühle und Regal sind vorhanden. Bettwäsche und Handtücher werden zur Verfügung gestellt.  Selbstzubereitung von Kaffee oder Tee ist möglich, mehr allerdings nicht.  Der Potsdamer Platz ist zu Fuß zu erreichen, für das Brandenburger Tor und das Reichstagsgebäude besser mit dem Fahrrad. Zwei U-Bahn-, eine S-Bahn-Station und eine Bus/Nachtbushaltestelle sind binnen fünf Minuten fußläufig zu erreichen. Die Berliner Sehenswürdigkeiten, wie zum Beispiel Brandenburger Tor,  Hackeschen Höfe, Reichstagsgebäude, Museumsinsel und vieles mehr erreicht man gut mit den öffentlichen Verkehrsmitteln. Parkplätze sind tagsüber schwer, abends aber ohne Probleme zu bekommen. Ich selbst bin eine gesellige Person, habe selbst schon viele Länder bereist. Ich spreche deutsc

house_rules: keine Partys - Berlin verfügt über genug Bars und Kneipen....
host_about:
Mein Name ist Rita Unruh, gebürtig komme ich aus Schleswig-Holstein, aber ich lebe schon sehr lange in Berlin. Meine Hobbies sind: Lesen, Tanzen, Reisen.
Ich bin ein geselliger Mensch, treffe mich gern mit Freunden zu Hause oder in der Kneipe. Gern gehe ich in Restaurants oder ins Kino/Philharmonie/Theater. Und von all dem bietet Berlin so viel, daß ich mir nicht mehr vorstellen könnte, woanders auf Dauer zu leben.

name: Bed+Breakfast near FU - park view
summary: Our house is in walking distance to the FU-Freie Universität - in the complete silence of residential Dahlem.  It takes 3 min to walk to the next U-Bahn station, 7 min to reach Ku' Damm and 20 min to reach Berlin-Mitte by car. Your car can easily be parked in front of the house.  The room is located in the second floor of the three-storied  spacious town house, that is classified as a historical monument.
space: Experience Berlin from a historical perspective of a listed ensemble, 7 minutes from the Kurfürstendamm and 3 min to the FU, located in a residential area and in complete tranquility.
description: Experience Berlin from a historical perspective of a listed ensemble, 7 minutes from the Kurfürstendamm and 3 min to the FU, located in a residential area and in complete tranquility. Now and then we get a lot of requests or have private guests from friends and family. Then the large bathroom with two sinks and the kitchen would be for all to use and to share. We live in the house - guests are on a separate floor. There is a small kitchen available so everyone can prepare breakfast on his own. A small supermarket in Dahlem-village is within walking distance. It's a 3  minutes walk from our house to the U-Bahn-station Dahlem-Dorf and there is easy access to the S-Bahn trains and buses. The Kurfürstendamm (City West) can be reached by car in 7 minutes, Berlin-Mitte in 20 minutes. In the quiet residential area are parking-lots at any time day or night. We love to host classic musicians.  … you can exercise on the piano if desired…and a the little romantic front yard is waiting for you to
notes: We love to host classic musicians.  … you can exercise on the piano if desired…and a the little romantic front yard is waiting for you to relax in the green after a long day ... I love to have a cup of tea with my guest and try to be helpful to make your stay easy, to match your expectations and to make you feel comfortable.

name: classy, central, relaxed
space: WHERE?  You will be living in the classy, quiet and much sought-after 'Bötzowviertel' of Prenzlauer Berg with its beautiful Art Nouveau buildings, just 3 tram-stops away from Alexanderplatz. There are excellent and affordable restaurants, coffee shops, bio food stores and a supermarkets nearby. The beautiful ’Volkspark Friedrichshain' is a 3 min. walk away and ideal for jogging & recreation. WHAT?  My 4-room apartment is on the 1st floor at the corner of the quiet Liselotte-Herrmann-Strasse / Bötzowstrasse. Your room is the only guest room and the bed is comfortable and of standard size. I supply bed sheets and towels and you can use the washing machine and washing powder. The big kitchen and its balcony is the center of the apartment where we gather, cook and drink good coffee.  I enjoy having guests and will make you feel welcome and at home. I speak fluently German, Danish, English and a bit French and Polish. EXTRAS You may use WIFI / W-LAN (5Mbps) if you promise to use it for non-

I am a cellist who loves music, conversations, cooking and good italian coffee. After having lived in several countries for more than 10 years, I settled in Berlin, where life is international, relaxed and relatively openminded.

I have a daughter who is 8 years old and lives with me every second week. We have been renting out a room in our big flat in Berlin (close to Alexanderplatz) for 2 years now and have enjoyed to meet so many lovely people.

name: Private Room in Central City West / 3
summary: The place is in a nice locality in the west center of Berlin, close to about everything and ca. 5 min. to day & night public transportation. The place offers small private rooms, equipped with double-bed, cloth hanger and desk with chairs. On the floor are the bathroom and the kitchen with micro oven, refrigerator, dishes etc. . Any time early self-check-in and late self-check-out. Special price offer right now, since we’re still finishing up some parts of other rooms at the place.

neighborhood_overview: This is an area with lots of cafes and restaurants, nearby shopping and 24/7 super market. We're very close to the famous Charlottenburg Palace with its unique baroque park, as well as the beautiful Lietzensee park with lake and lake-restaurant / café.
notes: Self check-in and self check-out are flexible with us. We offer early check-in and late check-out. Standard check-in is from 1:00 PM and standard check-out is until 12:00 noon. If your room is available earlier, we will fix it immediately and you can use it earlier. You can enter the place earlier and make yourself comfortable in the shared areas, use WiFi, bathroom and kitchen, until your room is available, respectively when your room is required by the following guest after 12:00 noon. You can deposit your luggage in the kitchen area and leave for the city to come back later and pick up your luggage. Please take your valuables with you.

name: Beautiful Room in Friedenau
summary: Hi :) I am glad you are here. When you have questions, just write me. You can write in german too. See you!
space: My room is bright and comfortable. I have a big wardrobe where you can place your clothes. Further some music boxes, a keyboard, desk and great books. The bathroom is beautiful with a rain shower and sunlight. The kitchen is full of sunlight and you have a lot of space to cook like you were home. Its great for couples or when you want to explore Berlin by yourself.
description: Hi :) I am glad you are here. When you have questions, just write me. You can write in german too. See you! My room is bright and comfortable. I have a big wardrobe where you can place your clothes. Further some music boxes, a keyboard, desk and great books. The bathroom is beautiful with a rain shower and sunlight. The kitchen is full of sunlight and you have a lot of space to cook like you were home. Its great for couples or when you want to explore Berlin by yourself. I share with Lisa and Charlene (21 and 25) the bathroom and kitchen. They are open-hearted people and help you out, when you need something. The whole accommodation are two flats which are connected through the kitchen. In the second flat (with his own bathroom) lives Peter (65). He is a warm and friendly person. We live in harmony together. You will recognize it. Sadly I am not there when you arrive. But my lovely roommates will welcome you. You can ask them whatever you want. Charlene was born in Berlin. She knows wh
neighborhood_overview: You will live in a beautiful area of Berlin with a excellent baker near by. The area is great for people who are not used to live in a big city with all his noise. I promise you don´t need earplugs when you choose this room. You will feel here comfortable and you are still near the city center. When you want some nature you have the green lung of Berlin – the Grunewald – close to you.
notes: Comfortable room + bed Luxury bathroom Bright, big kitchen Lovely roommates Safe area Close to the city centre This sounds like a good deal :)
transit: I love to take the bus. It´s like a sightseeing-tour. You pass the Bundestag, Brandenburger Tor, Potsdamer Platz and more. Otherwise you can take the underground. Only 5 minutes away. You reach with the U9 for example the great shopping mile Kurfürstendamm with the Kadewe in only 20 minutes.
access: I share with Lisa and Charlene (21 and 25) the bathroom and kitchen. They are open-hearted people and help you out, when you need something. The whole accommodation are two flats which are connected through the kitchen. In the second flat (with his own bathroom) lives Peter (65). He is a warm and friendly person. We live in harmony together. You will recognize it.
interaction: Sadly I am not there when you arrive. But my lovely roommates will welcome you. You can ask them whatever you want. Charlene was born in Berlin. She knows what you have to see in Berlin.
house_rules: Lisa and Charlene are vegetarians. It would be great if you won´t cook meat in the kitchen.
host_about:
Hi, 

my name is Fabian. I think I am a really uncomplicated host and guest. I respect other people and their places. I like reading, traveling, meeting new people and sports. 

I studied business psychology and publish a book in few weeks. 

looking forward seeing you, 
Fabian

neighborhood_overview: We are not living in the middle of the center but this part of Berlin shows how real germans live. You can find a little peace in the city. We became here real fanatics of this part of Berlin :) Under our flat there is a secret classic beer bar, with lovely atmosphere. we can show ou also where is the hidden ringbell to it :P
notes: We are living with our two lovely cats Bitchy and Dante. They are part of the family, so if you are not a pet lover or allergic please keep this in mind!
transit: The public transportation is very good, it's 15 minutes to get to the city center without change! We are living 1 minutes walk from stop Stresow of the line S5. With this line you can get to Charlottenburg in 10 mintes, to Zoologischer Garten in 15-20 minutes, to Alexander platz in 29 minutes. And the last stop of the line is Warchauer str. the main party area! There are several night buses just on out corner also!
access: You can use your own room, the kitchen, our huge bathroom with also a bath tub, the balcony. We can also show you a free parking if you need it.
interaction: We are working but not full time so we have also free time to show some cool bars in the city.
house_rules: Please note that the german rules are very strict with copyrights! Please don't download films, videos, music, etc. because the fine after one download can be 600 euros!  Also we would like to ask our guests (if it's possible) to leave the flat until 10am, because of the cleaning and the preparation of the room! Thank you for understanding!
host_about:
We are a couple of a hungarian girl from Budapest and an italian boy from Tuscany living now in Berlin with our two lovely cats. We love to travel and  meet new people! We love to eat, cook and drink a good italian wine watching the sunset! Even if this sounds a cliche , these are the great moment of life!
Feel free to contact us, we would love to host you ;-)

name: Living in a Loft - Bed n Breakfast
space: **The apartment / The loft** You will be staying in a 130 m² sized loft together with your hosts. The loft is in a lovingly restored factory on the 5th floor, underneath the roof (with lift). From here you have a breathtaking view over the rooftops of Berlin. You are welcome to share the use of the kitchen and the living room with us. Smoking is only permitted on the terrace. ** Situation ** The famous Simon-Dach-Strasse is a 5 minute walk away and is the mile in Friedrichshain for bar lovers, artists and tourists. The street lies in the heart of Berlin Friedrichshain and is famous for its charm. The homely and liberal atmosphere of this area comes from the variety of night-life, and makes this area especially inviting. Public transportation goes 24hours only 3 mins walk from our door.  **Your room** …is about 15 m² in size and you have it for yourself only. You sleep on a 200 x 140 bed. You have your own south-facing terrace with view over the courtyard, the rooftops and to the former

We are not able to prepare breakfast, so please help yourself.  If time permits, we love to have a long lasting breakfast on weekends. You are cordially invited.
house_rules: Our house rules: - please only wear slippers / house shoes in the apartment - before leaving the apartment, check that all windows and doors are closed - smoking permitted only on the terrace - don’t allow any strangers into the apartment - use of the telephone only after arrangement with the hosts Enjoy your stay!
host_about:
Berlin ist unsere Traumstadt - auch wenn sie dreckig und laut ist. Es macht einfach Spaß hier zu leben, weil die Stadt so vielseitig ist, tolle Ausgehmöglichkeiten hat, aber gleichzeitig so wunderbar grün ist und man viele unterschiedliche interessante Menschen kennenlernen kann. 

Wir sind beide berufstätig, arbeiten gern und viel. 

Wir  freuen uns darauf mit dir als Gast ein Stück Urlaubsgefühl ins Haus zu holen. 

Ihr wollt uns aus der Reserve locken? Fragt mich laufen zu gehen und meine Frau lockt man mit einer Frisbeescheibe in den Park. :))
------------

Berlin is our dream city - even if it is dirty and noisy. It is fun to live here because the city is so versatile, great nightlife, but has at the same time is so wonderfully green and you can meet so many different interesting people. We both work fulltime, almost workaholics.

We look forward to you as a guest to bring a piece of holiday feeling into hour home.

you want to see us happy? Ask me to go running and my wife are lured with a Frisbee in the park. :))

name: *sunny room in the heart of Xberg**
summary: Welcome to our sunny flat in Kreuzberg - or, actually in Kreuzkölln, in the buzzing heart of Berlin, at the beautiful riverside.
space: The flat is on the beautiful riverside (Maybachufer), you can see the canal from there. Sitting in the kitchen for a morning coffee with a book, listening to the calm river sounds or watching the amazing turkish market on Tuesday and Friday - it's simply invaluable. This is my favourite area in Berlin: green trees and blue sky, calm and fresh at the same time - cosy cafés and nice bars, many young people & party places, but if you want to read a book or just feel the sunshine, you can find many chilly and calm spots.  It's near to Kottbusser Tor, Schönleinstraße and Hermannplatz (U8, U1 and U7 subways), so take the public transport is really easy and comfortable.  You can visit every Tuesday & Friday the well-known Turkish market where you can buy everything or just listen the wonderful music of street bands and drink your coffee/ fresh squeezed orange juice - and actually, it happens just one step from the house.   The sunny, silent and nice room is 15 m² + we have a fully equipped ki

host_about:
*Sorry, this "describe yourself" is always difficult for me, but I'll try my best. 
I've studied theatre directing in Budapest, then I moved to Berlin in 2011. It was the beginning of an unpredictable and colorful life between two countries. After 3,5 years of my degree, I've decided to study a bit more - now I'm a guest student at the Ernst Busch University in Berlin for two semesters, I want to build it up here, what I've done in Budapest already. If I can work in Hungary as well - the situation is pretty difficult there -, I go back for some projects, but I'd like to perfect my German skills, watch the most interesting theatre directors and performances, enjoy the city, etc etc.

I like: jazz, berliner techno, old things, Truman Capote, J. D. Salinger, my iPod, my wonderful friends, to write, to cook, to create, to think, to travel a lot, the decoration of my flat, my bike, water, coffee, talking to strangers, wonderful accidents, falling stars and my Moleskine diaries. 

I'm afraid of night butterflies and bugs (!!!!) and hate not enough to sleep.

Hm. Is it okay? Hopefully.

neighborhood_overview: Home of this pretty accommodation is Friedrichshain, one of the central districs in Berlin, surrounded by Prenzlauer Berg, Mitte and Kreuzberg. Friedrichshain distinguishes himself as a student and artist district by its young and creative activities. Primarily due to the numerous bars, cafes, restaurants, galleries, theaters and cultural institutions with many really cheap small meal occasions with specialties from around the world. In addition, there's the spectacular collection of Berlin's best clubs, which are in large part all  within walking distance. Because in 200 meters distance, among other things, there is the Berghain / Panorama Bar, which was chosen not only by the New York Times as the "best club in the world".
notes: For privately motivated stays the Senate of Berlin requires 5% City Tax, which must additionally be paid on arrival. Business travelers are exempted from this rule, and are requested to to submit relevant supporting documents upon check-in.
transit: The connection to the public transport network (metro, urban railway, bus, tram) and the central location between Prenzlauer Berg and the Spree guarantee an ideal place to find us easily and to explore Berlin and its surroundings afterwords. Urban railway / S-Bahn: Warschauer Straße (S3, S5, S7, S75): 5 min Metro / U-Bahn: Warschauer Straße (U1): 6 min Frankfurter Tor (U5): 12 min Tram: Warschauer- / Revaler Straße (M10, M13): 4 min Bus: Helsingforser Platz (347, N1): 3 min (all times are by walking)

wir freuen uns sehr auf freundliche Gäste aus aller Welt und begrüßen Euch ganz herzlich!

Des Weiteren erwarten euch freundliches Personal, die weltweit größte Outdoor-Raucher-Lounge und eine 23h-Bar. Für eure Wünsche und Fragen haben wir rund um die Uhr ein offenes Ohr und helfen euch gern weiter mit Empfehlungen, Wegbeschreibungen etc.

Wir freuen uns auf Eure Anfragen!
Euer Sunflower-Team

Breakfast in the family-run restaurant opposite is included.

space: A quiet Refuge with Balcony in the beautiful Art Nouveau Friedenau Area. Only 15 Min to the western Center of the city (Zoologischer Garten). It is a beautiful, quiet area - built in the late 19th century. A little park and playground for Children nearby.  There is one bed (1,40 cm) and one Sofa that can be folded out - for example for kids - who are very welcome by the way.  The place is ok for 3 people if one or two of them are kids. It is a bit too small for 3 grown-ups. The kitchen and bathroom can be used together with me.  You will get a good nourishing breakfast - either fruits or Muesli or Bread and Jam / Ham - whatever you prefer.  Extra: I work as a life coach - so in case you are stuck somewhere you can book a coaching session with me.  U/S Bundesplatz und U / Rüdesheimer Platz.

name: Hyperion Berlin
summary: Entdecken Sie mit Berlin eines der beliebtesten Reiseziele in Europa und genießen angenehmen Komfort. Im Herzen von Berlin, im Stadtteil Wilmersdorf, nur rund zehn Gehminuten von der berühmten Shopping- und Flaniermeile Kurfürstendamm.
space: Unsere Vorteile auf einen Blick: •kostenfreies Highspeed-Internet (WLAN) • Flatscreen-TV • klimatisierte Zimmer - individuell regulierbar • Sky Programme inklusive • zentrale Lage  • gute Anbindung an den ÖPNV
description: Entdecken Sie mit Berlin eines der beliebtesten Reiseziele in Europa und genießen angenehmen Komfort. Im Herzen von Berlin, im Stadtteil Wilmersdorf, nur rund zehn Gehminuten von der berühmten Shopping- und Flaniermeile Kurfürstendamm. Unsere Vorteile auf einen Blick: •kostenfreies Highspeed-Internet (WLAN) • Flatscreen-TV • klimatisierte Zimmer - individuell regulierbar • Sky Programme inklusive • zentrale Lage  • gute Anbindung an den ÖPNV Die deutsche Geschichte hat dazu geführt, dass Berlin sowohl im Westen als auch im Osten über jeweils ein großes Hauptzentrum verfügt. Dieses liegt im Westteil der Stadt rund um den Kurfürstendamm und den Bahnhof Zoologischer Garten, während im Ostteil der Alexanderplatz, die Friedrichstraße und die Hackeschen Höfe die Mitte bilden. Das  Plaza Berlin City Centre Apartment liegt in der Nähe des Kurfürstendamms und somit im westlichen Berliner Zentrum, das Einwohner und Besucher gerne zum Einkaufen besuchen.

name: Sevenrooms - Berlin (Shabby Chic)
space: Willkommen in den SEVENROOMS BERLIN. Unsere privat geführten Unterkünfte befinden sich in einem typischen Berliner  Gründerzeithaus. Gelegen zwischen der Flaniermeile Kurfürstendamm und dem Hauptbahnhof und mit einer guten Verbindung zum Flughafen Tegel ist das Haus ein idealer Ausgangsort, um Berlin zu erkunden. Viele Sehenswürdigkeiten wie die Siegessäule, das Brandenburger Tor, der Reichstag, das Schloss Charlottenburg und die Spree sind von uns aus zu Fuß oder mit unseren hauseigenen Fahrrädern erreichbar. Die Fenster sind überwiegend nach Westen gelegen mit Blick auf die begrünte und verkehrsberuhigte Seitenstraße. . Bei Anfragen stehen wir Ihnen selbstverständlich jederzeit gern zur Verfügung. Ihr  Christian Fahland und Felix Korb

neighborhood_overview: "Moabit - Westfälisches Viertel Moabit - das ist mehr als Justizvollzugsanstalt und Turmstraße. Wem Prenzlauer Berg zu schnieke und Neukölln zu hip ist, der findet hier einen schönen kleinen Kiez: das Westfälische Viertel - Moabits familiäre Vorzeige-Ecke. Zwischen Stromstraße, Alt-Moabit, Gotzkowskystraße und Spree kann man in hübschen, günstigen Altbauten wohnen, am Wasser flanieren und in Walhalla Fiaker oder Buchkantine Kaffee trinken, ganz ohne Bling-Bling oder Chi-Chi."
transit: Entfernungen:  Hauptbahnhof 3km  Bahnhof Zoologischer Garten 3km  Regierungesviertel / Brandenburger Tor 3km  Kürfürstendam 3,5km  nächste Bushaltstelle (Alt Moabit/Gotzkowskystr.) 0,3km  nächste U-Bahnstation (Turmstr.) 0,5km  Flughafen Tegel 5km  Flughafen Schönefeld 30km  Messegelände ICC 5km  Alexanderplatz 6,5km  Sehenswürdigkeiten und touristische Ziele in unmittelbarer Umgebung:  Siegessäule ca. 17 Minuten Fussweg  Universall Hall Berlin ca. 3 Minuten Fussweg  Hamburger Bahnhof ca. 11 Minuten mit dem Bus

name: Beautiful Spacious Room in Berlin
summary: We're a couple renting out a private room in our spacious apartment. You'll have access to a large private bedroom with a king-size bed (180x200cm), as well as a shared kitchen and bathroom. Also included, is a light self-serve breakfast with coffee, tea, milk, cereal, fruit, bread and jam.
space: The flat is quite large, newly renovated, and has very high ceilings. We are the owners and it's our primary residence. It's in a nice old building built in 1904. The kitchen is fully equipped and you can feel free to use it. There's a laundry machine. Linens (sheets and blankets) and towels are included. The flat is kept very clean. We don't smoke and don't have pets. Please realise that this ad is for a private room in our apartment — meaning we live here and would be present during your stay. If you're looking for a full place to yourself, search Airbnb for "entire home" only.

neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is quiet with a lively main street nearby (Müller Strasse). There are lots of nice restaurants, cafés, a good brewery around the corner, grocery stores, etc.
notes: Our check in/out times are flexible. In the situation on checking-out that we have another guest arriving, we'd ask the room to be cleared in the morning (by around 10am) – but in this situation, you could always leave your bags in the flat to pick up later in the day if need be.
transit: The location is very well served by the metro system, with the M13 tram, and both the U6 and U9 subway lines, within a 5 minute radius. From these lines, Zoologischer Garten (7 minutes) and Friedrichstrasse (9 minutes) are easily accessible.  From Tegel Airport (TXL), it only takes about 30 minutes to our place on the metro. Buy an AB zone ticket from the yellow BVG machines and then take bus 128 (in the direction of Osloer Str.) to Kurt-Schumacher-Platz, and then transfer onto the U6 (subway line in the direction to Alt-Mariendorf) and get off at Seestr. We're then just a short walk down Brüsseler Strasse. From Schönefeld Airport (SXF) there are different options, but we prefer to take the RE7 train to Friedrich Strasse (in the direction to Dessau, Hauptbahnhof) and then transfer onto the U6 subway line (in the direction to Alt-Tegel). Get off at the Seestr. stop, and the apartment is a short walk down Brüsseler Strasse. From Schönefeld, you need to get an ABC ticket (only 3.30eur), w
interaction: Feel free to write in French or German, but sorry, we can only really speak English.
house_rules: Please don't download/upload any restricted/copyrighted content on the internet. German laws are quite strict in this regard and you'll be held responsible for paying any fines incurred during your stay.
host_about: My wife and I work together as professional artists and are both originally from Canada.

name: Room in charming neighbourhood
summary: 1 room, double bed(140cm), 16 minutes with public transportation to downtown Berlin,  walking distance to FU (Freie Universität Dahlem Campus). Lichterfelde West is a very safe, green but lively neighbourhood,  busses 24hrs, liitle cafés and shops around, and in our house there is a restaurant (open 8am to about 11 pm) downstairs
space: Come stay and enjoy sincere hospitality! Having hosted as a family many visitors, friends and au pairs from around the world, I will now be happy to welcome you in our former "family apartment". We have two rooms available, one double at 32,- and at times one single (28,-, I am trying to find out how to place a separate add), adjoining a comfortable living room with a fireplace. Two bathrooms, one with a small bathtub, the other with a shower are shared and I will enjoy offering you a typical "German breakfast" with Muesli, fruit and fresh rolls from our baker right across the street at an extra charge. But you can also use the kitchen and the fridge and serve yourself. There is a nice restaurant downstairs and several others in the neighbourhood. And I will be happy to assist with getting around in our exiting city :)

neighborhood_overview: This is a very relaxed and "green" part of Berlin, with many old villas.
notes: I speak English fluently since lived in the US for 8 years, some French and a bit of Spanish (but we do have very nice Spanish neighbours - just in case :) )
transit: 3 minutes from our apartement door to the S-Bahn, which runs every 10 minutes and takes 16 minutes to get downtown to Potsdamer Platz. Several busses to connect with the Underground or get home late at night (24 hours).

interaction: I will be very happy to have a chat and help with information about the city :)
house_rules: Feel free to play the piano at night, but please no smoking in the house (there are chairs in the backyard - meet and have a chat with the waiters downstairs) -  and no partying in the apartement - there are some great clubs downtown :)
host_about:
Meine Mitbewohner und ich bewohnen eine große 6-Zimmer-Wohnung. Da meine Söhne beide studieren sind Zimmer frei für nette Gäste. 
Ich habe selbst sehr schöne Erfahrungen mit kostenlosen "Surfing"-Aufenthalten. Airbnb finde ich ist eine gute Weiterentwicklung, denn in einem "richtigen, gebuchten" Bett schläft es sich noch ein wenig besser und der persönliche Austausch ist dennoch da.
Ich unterhalte mich sehr gerne und lerne Neues kennen - und ich tanze gerne und viel, z.Zt. vorallem Tango.

summary: Nice room 35 m2 (NOT APARTMENT!), for up to 6 people, centrally located in Schöneberg, close to Kurfürstendamm, KaDeWe. Nice cafes, restaurants and clubs in the neighborhood.  Shared bath and separate winter garden. 5th floor WITHOUT elevator.
space: Big 35m2 spacious room (NOT APARTMENT!) with separate winter garden and view over the city.  Marlene Dietrich lived in this original Berlin house from 1894 in her early days. 2 queen size beds 160 x 200 cm and 160 x 210 cm, 1 small queen size bed 120 x 200 cm in the winter garden and 1 guest mattress 100 x 200 cm. (The winter garden can't be darkened by curtains at night). Clean sheets and towels provided. 46" HD-TV, DVD/BluRay, a selection of international movies and TV series on DVD and BluRay, Radio and WLAN internet included.  Selfservice breakfast with coffee, tea, juice, bread, toast, mysli, yoghurt, cheese and cold cuts. Host speaks english, german and danish/swedish/norwegian.

Only a few hundred meters to Northern Europes biggest shoppingcenter KaDeWe and the famous Kurfürstendamm. Parking is easy to find and free of charge in the streets around the apartment.
notes: The apartment is on the fifth floor WITHOUT elevator…  good for preparing to the Berlin Marathon! The owner is a famous Danish musician and the apartment is filled with numerous awards. Please note! This is not an apartment but a guest room with separate winter garden. You have to share the bathroom with Your host. Please take care of our neighbors, so no noise on the staircase or room after 11pm.

summary: A well-situated furnished shared apartment in Charlottenburg within 10 mins. to Tegel Airport, with Bus M45 or underground station, Richard Wagner Platz to any destination in the city or outskirts.

The famous Pottery is also within walking distance. All the other sightseeing places are easily reached by underground station U-7 Richard Wagner Platz, or Bus M45 which goes to Zoologischer Garten, Technical University, etc. Bus 109 goes to the airport Tegel within 10mins or the S-Bahn Charlottenburg. Everything is very convenient, there is even a supermarket downstairs.
notes: Charlottenburg is a quiet, clean area, with tree-lined streets, gas lamps and many many restaurants catering to everyone.

access: The shared furnished apartment is fully furnished with amenities like washer, dishwasher, kitchen utensils, coffee and tea machines, towels, hand towels. There is a an internet access available for a minimal charge. Guests may use them properly.
interaction: I am usually available for my guests if you would need some information about the city, the whereabouts, places to visit, what tickets to get, where to get them, etc. So if there is a request for shows, concerts please inform me ahead. I will gladly inform you. I am an avid fan of classical music and the Philharmonie offers the best.
house_rules: Housekeys deposit will be charged with 100 Eur. Absolutely non-smoking room and building. Smoking is only allowed outside the building premises. No unauthorized visitors allowed, for security reasons.  For weekly or monthly boarders, breakfast is not included, but coffee and tea machines are provided for. Please email me if you need further information, I will gladly inform you. There is also an end-cleaining fee of 35 Euro plus 400 Euro for a deposit.
host_about:
I do love to travel when I get the chance to get away for a few days or weeks visiting different continents with my backpack and roller (luggage). My best stays have been spent at bed and breakfast at different countries. I always learn something new by staying with guest families and hosts, they are my best teachers to immerse oneself into the local culture. 
My best cooking recipes have been taught by the locals and the best sightseeing trips organized by the host families.
I am looking forward to meet you and wish you a great stay in Berlin!

neighborhood_overview: Friedrichshain is definitely one of the neighbourhoods to visit. Although it has more and more tourists coming its still feels like a real neighbourhood, with many busy small streets full with all kinds of shops, from bakeries and biomarkets, to fashion, furniture, second hand clothing, record stores, etc. If your intention is to check the night scene Bargain and RAW is just around the corner. If you're looking for an easy going walking around the city, you'll surely enjoy Boxhagener Flee Market on Sundays and the food market on Saturdays, and the many many cafes, bars and little restaurants that are all around.
notes: Theres no elevator since its an old 19th century building! But fortunately we're only on the first floor. Unfortunately, this means it has no wheelchair access.
transit: Theres several tram stops literally around the corner, not even 1minute walk, and the closest metro and sbahn station is Frankfurter Allee, only 3 minutes walking distance or less if you are fast!
access: Its a shared apartment so you'll have access to the common areas  (kitchen, living room and bathroom) to be shared with two other guest rooms.
interaction: I'll do my best to give all my tips and knowledge about Berlin and my favourite places, as well as tips for transportation, things to do, bike rental, concerts and a long etc!
house_rules: - Please be considerate to other guests and neighbours after 23,30hrs  -Be respectful to others no matter nationality, gender or sexual orientation -Take care of common areas since its all about being able to enjoy the same living areas, so please clean up after you use the kitchen and leave things as you found them -Smoking will be allowed only in the balcony -Pets might be allowed prior notice and depending only if the other guests in the house or following guests for the room are ok with it.  -There's the option of using our laundry service for 4 euros. ** Note that for the next two weeks I will be redecorating the other bedroom of the apartment, but you'll have access to bathroom, kitchen and living room. It will just mean there will be fewer guests in the apartment and working on the other bedroom (no noise or strange smells to bother you are assured!)
host_about:
Hi, I'm a young artist living in Berlin, love plants, animals, cooking, travelling, going to the cinema, nice talks and meeting new people!
I started travelling alone at a very young age and did a round the world trip for half a year once! Was in every continent but Antartica (!) So stayed in many hostels and loggings, met really lovely people all over the place and would like to think I could also be as helpful and giving as many others have been with me, so I very much enjoy being a host and feeling helpful. Also being in contact with travellers is always inspiring and theres something contagious about the excitement of a new place!
I love music, art and culture in general, but a good meal or a nice nap in the sun can be a lot better than any theatre play masterpiece! So I think I really go for simple things.
When I travel I like to take my time to enjoy the place, most of the time I find more inspiring to go to food markets or local places or meet nice people rather than stressing myself to go visit all the must see places.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in a quiet, beautiful street close to the Platz der Luftbrücke. Around the corner there are some nice shops with local flavor, in the Bergmannstrasse very close, there are a lot of cafes, bars, boutiques and restaurants. The market hall is Marheinekeplatz as well special. Nextdoor you will find a lot of green also: the Victoria Park is very close, just like the wonderful park: the famous former Tempelhof airfield.
notes: Two nights minimum stay
transit: U6 Haltestelle Platz der Luftbrücke Bus 114 Platz der Luftbrücke Bus 248 Bayernring S-Bahn Ring 750 meters Berlin has a very dense public transport network. Many sights are directly and rapidly accessible. Because of the central location most guests leave their cars at our place or do not bring it with them. Potsdamer Platz, Alexanderplatz, Ku'damm, museums and exhibitions to get easily by public transport (or car). At the Landwehrkanal you're on foot or by bike in a few minutes, as the Victoria Park with its waterfall and the Tempelhoferfeld. The bus takes you in a few minutes at the station "Südkreuz", where most distance trains stop. The main train station you reach comfortably  by underground and S-Bahn within fifteen minutes. Tegel Airport in the north is easily accessible by public transportation (bus and subway) as also is the Schoenefeld Airport in the south of Berlin.

description: Unsere 3 Komfortzimmer (Goldzimmer, Shabby Chic und Birkenzimmer) haben wir mit viel Liebe zum Detail eingerichtet. Die Fenster sind teilweise nach Westen gelegen mit Blick auf die begrünte und verkehrsberuhigte Seitenstraße.   Alle Komfortzimmer sind frisch renoviert, mit Kühlschrank (Minibar), Safe, Fön, Bettwäsche, Handtücher, kostenlose Pflegeprodukte, Zugang zu einer Waschmaschine/Trockner, Internet (W-Lan), Kaffeemaschine, Wasserkocher (Tee) und TV (50 Zoll) ausgestattet und befinden sich ebenerdig. Dienstleistungen: Zimmerservice, Shuttleservice (gegen Aufpreis), Express-Check-in/-out, Informationsschalter für Ausflüge, Gepäckaufbewahrung, Weckservice/Wecker. Fahrradverleih: Gegen eine Leihgebühr von EUR 10,- pro Tag. Täglicher Zimmerservice: Kann für € 15,- / Tag dazu gebucht werden. Gesprochene Sprachen: Englisch, Deutsch "Moabit - Westfälisches Viertel Moabit - das
neighborhood_overview: "Moabit - Westfälisches Viertel Moabit - das ist mehr als Justizvollzugsanstalt und Turmstraße. Wem Prenzlauer Berg zu schnieke und Neukölln zu hip ist, der findet hier einen schönen kleinen Kiez: das Westfälische Viertel - Moabits familiäre Vorzeige-Ecke. Zwischen Stromstraße, Alt-Moabit, Gotzkowskystraße und Spree kann man in hübschen, günstigen Altbauten wohnen, am Wasser flanieren und in Walhalla Fiaker oder Buchkantine Kaffee trinken, ganz ohne Bling-Bling oder Chi-Chi."
notes: Kinder und Zustellbetten: Alle Kinder sind willkommen. Alle Kinder unter 2 Jahren zahlen EUR 25 pro Nacht für ein Babybett. Alle Kinder unter 12 Jahren zahlen EUR 35 pro Nacht für Zustellbetten. Alle weiteren älteren Kinder oder Erwachsene zahlen EUR 45 pro Nacht für Zustellbetten. Die Zimmer bieten Platz für maximal 2 Zustellbetten . Kinder- bzw. Zustellbetten sind nur auf Anfrage erhältlich und müssen in jedem Fall von der Unterkunft bestätigt werden. Zusätzliche Kosten sind nicht im Gesamtpreis enthalten und müssen separat während Ihres Aufenthaltes bezahlt werden. Haustiere:  Haustiere sind auf Anfrage gestattet. Gebühren können erhoben werden. Zahlung: Vorauszahlung oder bar bei Anreise. Kartenzahlung ist nicht möglich. Stornierung/Vorauszahlung:  Das Zimmer steht Ihnen am Anreisetag ab 14.00 Uhr und am Abreisetag bis 11.00 Uhr zur Verfügung. Sofern Ihre Anreise nach 18.00 Uhr erfolgt, bitten wir um eine entsprechende Information Ihrerseits, ansonsten behalten wir uns vor, das Zim

neighborhood_overview: Home of this pretty accommodation is Friedrichshain, one of the central districs in Berlin, surrounded by Prenzlauer Berg, Mitte and Kreuzberg. Friedrichshain distinguishes himself as a student and artist district by its young and creative activities. Primarily due to the numerous bars, cafes, restaurants, galleries, theaters and cultural institutions with many really cheap small meal occasions with specialties from around the world. In addition, there's the spectacular collection of Berlin's best clubs, which are in large part all  within walking distance. Because in 200 meters distance, among other things, there is the Berghain / Panorama Bar, which was chosen not only by the New York Times as the "best club in the world".
notes: For privately motivated stays the Senate of Berlin requires 5% City Tax, which must additionally be paid on arrival. Business travelers are exempted from this rule, and are requested to to submit relevant supporting documents upon check-in.
transit: The connection to the public transport network (metro, urban railway, bus, tram) and the central location between Prenzlauer Berg and the Spree guarantee an ideal place to find us easily and to explore Berlin and its surroundings afterwords. name: Charming bedroom For Rent in Berlin
summary: Surrounded by the parks of Volkspark Rehberge, Schillerpark and Leopoldplatz, this comfortable bedroom is situated within the dynamic neighbourhood of Wedding. Satellite TV, a DVD player and Wi-Fi are available.
space: Surrounded by the parks of Volkspark Rehberge, Schillerpark and Leopoldplatz, this comfortable bedroom is situated within the dynamic neighbourhood of Wedding. Satellite TV, a DVD player and Wi-Fi are available. Traditional wooden flooring, framed artwork and a large wardrobe are all included in this bright double bedroom. Guests are permitted to use the computer, as well as the fully-equipped kitchen where they can both cook and enjoy meals. Often described as “a shopping centre with a rail connection”, Berlin Hauptbahnhof Train Station is just 10 minutes’ away by bus. Hosting a large flea market and a popular karaoke show on a Sunday, Mauerpark is a 25-minute bus journey away. Guests can spend the day at Tegeler See Lake, a beautiful place for talking walks, sailing or bathing.

neighborhood_overview: Sprengelkiez: schöner wohnen am (URL HIDDEN) einem Ufercafé sitzen oder in einer Hausbrauerei? Das dicht bebaute Wohnviertel rund um die Sprengel- und die Tegeler Straße verfügt neben einer weitgehend intakten Altbausubstanz aus der Gründerzeit über eine richtige Wasserlage. Im Südwesten des Kiezes verläuft nämlich der Berlin-Spandauer Schiffahrtskanal. Die ausgebaute Uferpromenade mit ihren repräsentativen Wohnhäusern aus der Zeit um 1900 lädt zu Spaziergängen und zu Cafébesuchen ein. Wie an keiner anderen Stelle im Wedding reihen sich hier gastronomische Betriebe aneinander, sowohl traditionelle Kneipen(Lindengarten, Deichgraf) als auch neuere Cafés und Restaurants (Fünfundsechzig, Auszeit). Ebenfalls im Sprengelkiez besteht seit ein paar Jahren die Weddinger Hausbrauerei Eschenbräu, wo man im Sommer in einem schattigen Biergarten im Hinterhof sitzen kann. eben dem Sparrplatz und dem Pekinger Platz (am Kanal) ist hier vor allem der Sprengelpark zu nennen. Auf dem 10 000 qm großen ehe
transit: U9 Amrumer Straße, U6 Wedding oder Leopoldplatz. Bus 142 Samoastraße
access: Küche und Bad teilen wir uns
interaction: Ja ich wohne selbst auch in der Wohnung
host_about: Servus, Bon Jour, Buenos Dias, Djien Dobre, Privet! :) Hier noch kurz ein Paar Worte über mich: Vor 20 Jahren für den Traumberuf in die Traumstadt gezogen. Seitdem großer Fan von Berlin. Jeden Tag sogar ein Stückchen mehr. Ich bin beruflich viel unterwegs. Freue mich aber bei jeder Rückkehr riesig auf´s "Heim-kommen". Anfang 40er freut sich also auf viele spannende und selbst neugierige Gäste. Ob beruflich oder privat, ich hoffe ich kann mit meinem Heim einen Teil dazu beitragen, einen tollen Aufenthalt in einer der schönsten Städte zu verbringen. Freu mich auf euch - die neuen Berlin-Fans! Herzlich Willkommen! :)

neighborhood_overview: The appartement is located in the heart of former West-Berlin, in Charlottenburg, surrounded by parks, lakes and the Grunewald (very large forest) (perfect for swimmers and joggers) and close to Messe Berlin (exhibition grounds). Nearby you find a comfortable shopping situation (high-class designer fashion stores, budget boutiques, supermarkets, shopping mall). You will also find various restaurants, clubs and bars just minutes away. You also won't be disappointed if you're looking for culture and arts (i.e. Schloss Charlottenburg, Berggruen-Museum, Schaubühne, KaDeWe, Olympiastadion, The Museum für Fotografie (Museum of Photography), Bikini-Haus, Zoologischer Garten (animal zoo) and a lot more)

neighborhood_overview: Home of this pretty accommodation is Friedrichshain, one of the central districs in Berlin, surrounded by Prenzlauer Berg, Mitte and Kreuzberg. Friedrichshain distinguishes himself as a student and artist district by its young and creative activities. Primarily due to the numerous bars, cafes, restaurants, galleries, theaters and cultural institutions with many really cheap small meal occasions with specialties from around the world. In addition, there's the spectacular collection of Berlin's best clubs, which are in large part all  within walking distance. Because in 200 meters distance, among other things, there is the Berghain / Panorama Bar, which was chosen not only by the New York Times as the "best club in the world".
notes: For privately motivated stays the Senate of Berlin requires 5% City Tax, which must additionally be paid on arrival. Business travelers are exempted from this rule, and are requested to to submit relevant supporting documents upon check-in.
transit: The connection to the public transport network (metro, urban railway, bus, tram) and the central location between Prenzlauer Berg and the Spree guarantee an ideal place to find us easily and to explore Berlin and its surroundings afterwords. Urban railway / S-Bahn: Warschauer Straße (S3, S5, S7, S75): 5 min Metro / U-Bahn: Warschauer Straße (U1): 6 min Frankfurter Tor (U5): 12 min Tram: Warschauer- / Revaler Straße (M10, M13): 4 min Bus: Helsingforser Platz (347, N1): 3 min (all times are by walking)

Hallo,
wir freuen uns sehr auf freundliche Gäste aus aller Welt und begrüßen Euch ganz herzlich!

Im Sunflower Hostel stehen euch gemischte Mehrbettzimmer und geschlechtergetrennte Gemeinschaftsbäder zur Verfügung. Des Weiteren erwarten euch freundliches Personal, die weltweit größte Outdoor-Raucher-Lounge und eine 23h-Bar. Für eure Wünsche und Fragen haben wir rund um die Uhr ein offenes Ohr und helfen euch gern weiter mit Empfehlungen, Wegbeschreibungen etc.

Wir freuen uns auf Eure Anfragen!
Euer Sunflower-Team

name: Green Berlin
summary: We live very near to the Treptower Park on one side, and Kreuzberg (Schlesische Strasse) with many retaurants, bars, diners and clubs on the other side. If you want to go jogging you only have to cross the street in front of our house, then you can run for kilometers along the river Spree through the park and even into a forest.  Our house is very near to some of the most famous areas of Berlin in Friedrichshain and Kreuzberg, nevertheless our house has a huge garden in the back which nearly let`s you forget that you are in Berlin. We are part of a group of friendly people who together built 8 houses (4 apartments  in every house), so we use the garden altogether. The main room is the livingroom combined with the kitchen, which has the view into the garden and a nice terrace in front of it which is inviting to have dinner outside or a glass of (EMAIL HIDDEN) front of the house we have our own parkingplace which means that we never have trouble finding a parkinglot at home..  Our flat i

name: X-Berg: central, quiet, bright, cosy and large
summary: In the heart of Kreuzberg, two minutes from the international, multi-cultural hustle and bustle of the famous Oranienstrasse, the room is located very quiet at the end of a large apartment with a view over a typical, historic Berlin commercial courtyard (and a chestnut tree). In the neighborhood there is a little farm, so that one may wake up in the morning by the crowing of the rooster. The guests (there is a second guest room) have their own newly renovated large bathroom.
space: The guest room is 25-m2 in size and is located on a 150-m2 large apartment opposite the guest bathroom. It has a new 1.80 m wide bed with new mattress, wardrobe, TV, sofa and a dining table with chairs. It is also equipped with a microwave, a coffee maker, kettle, crockery, coffee, tea, and a small refrigerator, so that you prepare your own meals/breakfast if you want (I don't serve breakfast! :) ) The flat (where the rental room is located) is in a very peaceful neighbourhood, and in the morning guests might even be awakened by a real cock crowing since there is a farm very nearby. Although this is an idyllic setting, the accommodation is actually very close to the typical Berlin district of Kreuzberg, which is home to the famous street “Oranienstraße” with its numerous bars, restaurants, small terraces and international cuisine. In just a short stroll visitors can reach the famous bars „Sage-Club“, „Kater Holzig“, "SO36", "Berghain" and more.

neighborhood_overview: Hey, it's Kreuzberg :)
notes: The room / apartment is located in the rear house / garden house on the 3rd floor (no elevator). Since 1.1.2014 Berlin tourists have to pay the city tax, the fee is now included in the price.
transit: The underground station Kottbusser Tor and the stop of the Metro Bus #29 are five minutes walking distance. There is also a bus directly from Ostbahnhof (#140) or Hauptbahnhof (#147), stops are next to my house.  By public transport you are in a few minutes either at Alexanderplatz, former Checkpoint Charlie and it's museum, Jewish Museum, to the Hackescher Markt, Unter den Linden, the Ku-Damm and the Memorial Church, Potsdamer Platz and or the Museum Island. For guests arriving by car there is easy parking right outside in front of the house.  And for the brave of you: I also have two new bike to rent (8€ p. day/bike with quantity discount and incl. a Berlin biking map) :)
access: All guests (there is a second guestroom, too) share a private bathroom (see photo).
interaction: I've been living here for 35 years and I'm happy to help, just ask.Hey, it's Kreuzberg :)
house_rules: First Rule: Have Fun! Beside that: Please don't bring other people in my house, especially not over night! And please turn off any file-sharing software and do not stream movies on your internet connection, it's very expensive in Germany and I have to charge you...
host_about:
Mein Name ist Gabriele, ich bin Künstlerin, Fotografin, Filmemacherin und lebe seit 35 Jahren in Berlin-Kreuzberg. 
I am an artist working with photography and film, living in Berlin since 35 years.

name: great times in the heart of P'Berg
summary: Let yourself be surprised
space: I would be very happy to welcome you in my apartment and have you here as my guest. I want you to feel very comfortable so feel free to ask me anything you want to know as I am a very open and communicative person. Your room has a big bed, a little desk, a shelf and a cupboard in which you can put all your clothes. You dont need to worry about sheets and towels.  Also toast and coffee or tea are inclueded for your breakfast. Of course you can use the kitchen and the bathroom (including washing machine and hairdryer) as many times as well. The Kollwitzstraße is one of the most famous streets in prenzauer berg. On thursdays and saturdays you'll find a nice market just a few meters away from my house. Also the popular "mauerpark" is right around the corner that most people go to on sundays because of the flea market and entertaining music. neighborhood_overview: We respect one another :)
transit: My apartment is literally surrounded by public transports. It's amazing how nicely trams and trains can take you from my place to every other corner to Berlin in any time of the day or night. ;) I think Berlin is known for the well public transport connection, organization especially that they are running at all times. So you don't need to worry about getting around from my place!! :)
access: You get your own keys and you can step in and out the apartment anytime you like. You have access to kitchen and bathroom at all times and of course to your private room.
interaction: I prefer to check in my guest personally but in the past I left the keys at some shop to let my guests step in to the apartment themselves. But there is at least one time that I introduce myself and the apartment. It's always nice to know who you're living with and to explain things that might be unclear. Most of the time the people that come have some questions that I am happy to answer or some other concerns that I try my best to help out with. Otherwise I'm always available either by my mobile phone when I'm not there or by talking to me in person when I'm in the house. I'm always happy to help out or have a nice chat about the day or anything ;) It depends on the guest that is staying at my place though. Some people have a lot of questions or need help in certain things. And sometimes it happens that my guest and I meet up in the kitchen so we chat. Maybe it becomes a nice conversation and that's what I appreciate. And some guests prefer to stay alone, enjoy their privacy or they a
house_rules: Make yourselves at home and enjoy your time.
host_about:
Hello, my name is Therese. 
First of all I am a very open and communicative person. I like meeting people from all over the world. In 2007 I  travelled around australia and through some countries in asia for 16 months. Thats where I learned most of my english. 
Back in Berlin I started my work as a kinderagarden teacher until I was desperate to go traveling again. In 2012 I started Airbnb and hosting. I loved that experience straight away and each person that I had as my guest brought in a feeling of traveling that let my wish for traveling constantly grow. In 2014 I spent one year in New Zealand and it was a beautiful time out in the nature for a change after so many years living in The city. Since summer 2015 Im back home in Berlin. Now I'm back home refreshed with new ideas and inspired from my journey that is still very present in very good way. I'm working in the kindergarten again and I appreciate the time with the children. Spending my days with the kids is a lot of work but especially a lot of fun. 
In my spare time I'm an active person (I love being outside riding the bike or spend time in the parks, meeting friends, listening to music, singing, playing piano and the guitar, or cook delicious food...)
I grew up in Berlin and I know almost every corner here. I'm good for insider tips as well.

summary: I rent my sunny bedroom in this cozy old building. Located at the best kiez of Berlin, overlooking the park, you will love it. Lots of cool locations and bars like Berghain CDV or Watergate are around the corner. The bathroom is very small, please look at the pics! If you are looking for hotelcomfort, dont book here. The kitchen is just to use by arrangement with me. Uptight poeple are not welcome! If I am on holidays myself,  my neighbour will take care about you! 2 bikes  for rent
space: Wonderful southwest overview of the Park, lots of cool locations around the corner, very nice indian hippiestyle furniture with lots of unique lights, like a mathmos projector and candle lights, a round dining table. The bed is 140x200 size. The rented room is 20qm and accessible via my livingroom, where I will be quite often, because I'm living in this flat. So if you are looking for an undisturbed hotelroom, you should not book.  Some nights you will hear the base of the Club underneath, and in the summertime you will hear the partypoeple passing by, we are in Kreuzberg, you know?!?! If you take offence to free pictures, or my very private enviroment, you are not welcome, please understand, that I am opening my house for you, so please accept my personality, which breathes through the whole flat! Self-evident I will enter your room, when you are not there, to water the plants and air the room by opening the windows. The bathroom is very small, please look at the pics, if you are look

neighborhood_overview: SO 36 is the best corner of the city, I love it! at the park you will have Woodstock feeling, cool croud around, nice cheep restaurants and unique locations around the corner, the famous Oberbaumbrücke, the old borderline, is 5 min. by feet, all good clubs you can reach by feet.
notes: I'm practicing buddhism since 1985, so once in a while you will see me kneeing in front of my altar doing my meditation, chanting the mantra Nam Myo Ho Renge Kyo, so don't panic if you here a crazy pronounced litany..
transit: 3 min. to the U1 the first east west connection the Citybus M29 as well Airport TXL: 15,0km Airport SXF: 19,07km  ÖPNV: 0,3km Eastcenter: 4,4 km Messe/Exhibition Center: 15,6km Highway: 5,3km Main Railwaystation/ Hauptbahnhof: 7,6km Ostbahnhof: 3,2km
access: You get keys to the front door, the flat is on the first floor of the front house
interaction: as I'm living in Berlin since 1983 I can tell you a lot about the City, I would love to give you good and unique advices for your entertaining. I'm a selfemployed actress, so home in the daytime, out in the night, sleeping long.. Uptight poeple who are looking in the corners to find any shortcommings, or dont open their mouth to speak out are not welcome!
house_rules: You will find some printed detailed house roules on the table, please read them carefully. dont tell anybody that youre from airbnb, the legal situation in Berlin is ambiguous, so just tell your name at the doorbell. Smoking is allowed, just air the room once in a while. Please dont use strong smelling deo or parfume, specially AXE is forbidden, I hate it ;-) You can bring your pet. Please make sure that the door is closed, because its old, you have to push it carefully but definitely beeing clean wouldnt be bad tell me if something breaks down, specialy the bikes!!!!
host_about:
Ich bin eine Berliner Künstlerin, führe ein unkonventionelles Leben, ich liebe Tanzen, Lachen, Berliner Partys, Movies, Spaziergänge mit meinem Hund, ich selbst bin Traveller, keine Pauschalreisen, esse gern italienisch, asiatisch und französisch.
Love Peace and Harmony!

name: Dahlem am Grunewald
summary: 65qm flat in Grunewald close to Kurfürstendamm  In summer you can walk to the beach nearby and swim in the Grunewald lake. By bus or tube to the center of West Berlin it takes 15 minutes. From the bedroom you have a beautiful view at the Kunsthaus Dahlem. One block ahead you can visit the wellknown "Brücke-Museum."  There is  a balcony to sit outside. On sunny days you can take your meals outside in the garden. You may use two bycicles. The garden is haunted by two cats and our Dalmatian.

name: Tiny,but awesome! Zimmer im Wedding
summary: For english people -- scroll down! Wir bieten Euch ein kleines, aber helles Zimmer mit einem Bett und einem Kleiderschrank.  Ihr könnt unser Wohnzimmer zum Chillen nutzen, die Küche zum Kochen inkl. frischer Kräuter im Sommer und das Bad natürlich. Kaffee und Tee, gibt's von uns, so viel Ihr wollt! :)
space: Facts Wir bieten unser Zimmer nur für Leute an, die beruflich, schulisch etc. in Berlin sein möchten.  Wichtig Dies ist keine Wohnung, welche Ihr allein für Euch habt, Ihr lebt die ganze Zeit mit uns zusammen dort. Wenn es zeitlich passt, würden wir gern mit Euch zusammen sitzen, feiern gehen, kochen etc. und Euch kennenlernen.  Da wir beide berufstätig sind, gehören kleine Absprachen, wer morgens wann das Bad nutzt z.B. dazu :) Ihr könnt nutzen, was im Kühlschrank ist, solltet aber auch nachkaufen, wenn etwas fehlt. Ein Geben und Nehmen eben. Das Zimmer 8,5 m² Zimmer mit Single-Bett zum Ausziehen (dann für 2), Nachttisch, Kleiderschrank und einem Regal Nutzung der kompletten Wohnung, fühlt Euch wie zu Hause =) Wohnzimmer ist mit TV, Wii und vielen Gesellschaftsspielen ausgestattet. Dazu haben wir einen Balkon, der für 2 Leute ideal ist. Hier kann auch geraucht werden. WLAN gibt es natürlich auch. Frühstück Kaffee und Tee gibt es von uns gratis!  Zum Essen schaut einfach, was da ist. M

Je vis à Berlin depuis plus de 15 ans. Je connais bien la ville et aime l'Allemagne. Je suis freelance et m'intéresse à la photo, l'art, le Street-art, la culture, la littérature...

name: Kreuzberg: central, calm, spacious and cosy
summary: In the heart of Kreuzberg and  just two minutes from the international, multi-cultural hustle and bustle of the famous Oranienstrasse, the room is very quiet at the end of a large apartment with a view of our beautiful Berlin backyard. The guests (there is a second guest room) have their own newly renovated large bathroom.
space: The guest room is very quiet and bright (with morning sun), large (25-m2) and is located at the end of a 150-m2 apartment next to the bathroom.  It has just been renovated (June '13), has a new 1.60 m wide bed, a comfortable sofa, a large table with two chairs, a sink with stove and refrigerator, coffee maker, kettle and various utensils for self catering.  Despite the quiet location you walk just two minutes to the typical multi-cultural Kreuzberg scene of the famous Oranienstrasse next to U-Bahn Kottbusser Tor. You can have breakfast in countless coffee houses, eat in different restaurants with culinary delights and snacks cheap and tasty once around the globe. There is a wide selection of trendy bars, cocktail bars and typical old Berlin pubs as the "Max and Moritz" or "Henne". Internationally known clubs such as the "Sage Club", "Kater Holzig" or "Ritter Butzke" can easily be reached on foot.

neighborhood_overview: Home of this pretty accommodation is Friedrichshain, one of the central districs in Berlin, surrounded by Prenzlauer Berg, Mitte and Kreuzberg. Friedrichshain distinguishes himself as a student and artist district by its young and creative activities. Primarily due to the numerous bars, cafes, restaurants, galleries, theaters and cultural institutions with many really cheap small meal occasions with specialties from around the world. In addition, there's the spectacular collection of Berlin's best clubs, which are in large part all  within walking distance. Because in 200 meters distance, among other things, there is the Berghain / Panorama Bar, which was chosen not only by the New York Times as the "best club in the world".
notes: For privately motivated stays the Senate of Berlin requires 5% City Tax, which must additionally be paid on arrival. Business travelers are exempted from this rule, and are requested to to submit relevant supporting documents upon check-in.
transit: The connection to the public transport network (metro, urban railway, bus, tram) and the central location between Prenzlauer Berg and the Spree guarantee an ideal place to find us easily and to explore Berlin and its surroundings afterwords. Urban railway / S-Bahn: Warschauer Straße (S3, S5, S7, S75): 5 min Metro / U-Bahn: Warschauer Straße (U1): 6 min Frankfurter Tor (U5): 12 min Tram: Warschauer- / Revaler Straße (M10, M13): 4 min Bus: Helsingforser Platz (347, N1): 3 min (all times are by walking)
access: In addition to bedding and free towels, there are washers, dryers, TV and also free Wi-Fi available in the common room.
interaction: You will be welcomed by our friendly and open Staff, who will help you with good advices and guarantee a great stay in our hostel.

wir freuen uns sehr auf freundliche Gäste aus aller Welt und begrüßen Euch ganz herzlich!

Im Sunflower Hostel stehen euch gemischte Mehrbettzimmer und geschlechtergetrennte Gemeinschaftsbäder zur Verfügung. Des Weiteren erwarten euch freundliches Personal, die weltweit größte Outdoor-Raucher-Lounge und eine 23h-Bar. Für eure Wünsche und Fragen haben wir rund um die Uhr ein offenes Ohr und helfen euch gern weiter mit Empfehlungen, Wegbeschreibungen etc.

Wir freuen uns auf Eure Anfragen!
Euer Sunflower-Team

host_about:
I think I could say I am free, open, easy, tolerant, dreamy, smily, authentic, analog, emphatic, confidence, caring. Enthusiastic, passionate. A bit fool. I am vegetarian, I make daily yoga and sport.  But i also love goings to bars and dancing. 

I couldnt live without music, drawing, books, cameras , sun, sea, friends, art , water & bananas. 

I love to travel for meeting myself in a different circumstances and making an exchange with the world and the people who one meet on the way. For learning. I am quite addicted to this exchange of new people and experiences.  I travel on my own city often, trying to watch it as if I was a tourist, as the first time again.  
I never had bad experiences traveling, and I believe is cause of the energy one projects . World is energy on movement and I enjoy going within it.
My best journey was walking alone "El camino de santiago"in Spain. India and Israel were also amazing-life-changing trips.  
I was "couchsourfer" for a long time when I was younger and I host over 100 people for free in Spain and Germany, that gave me a lot of life-teaching, a lot of respect , and unfortunately also a bit of suspicion.

summary: Beautiful bright big bedroom with sofa bed and dinning table, very simple but with all you'll need and truly charming. In an old big apartment in center Friedrichshain walking distance from everything and well comunicated with metro, sbahn, tram, etc
description: Beautiful bright big bedroom with sofa bed and dinning table, very simple but with all you'll need and truly charming. In an old big apartment in center Friedrichshain walking distance from everything and well comunicated with metro, sbahn, tram, etc
host_about:
Hi, I'm a young artist living in Berlin, love plants, animals, cooking, travelling, going to the cinema, nice talks and meeting new people!
I started travelling alone at a very young age and did a round the world trip for half a year once! Was in every continent but Antartica (!) So stayed in many hostels and loggings, met really lovely people all over the place and would like to think I could also be as helpful and giving as many others have been with me, so I very much enjoy being a host and feeling helpful. Also being in contact with travellers is always inspiring and theres something contagious about the excitement of a new place!
I love music, art and culture in general, but a good meal or a nice nap in the sun can be a lot better than any theatre play masterpiece! So I think I really go for simple things.
When I travel I like to take my time to enjoy the place, most of the time I find more inspiring to go to food markets or local places or meet nice people rather than stressing myself to go visit all the must see places.

host_about:
I do love to travel when I get the chance to get away for a few days or weeks visiting different continents with my backpack and roller (luggage). My best stays have been spent at bed and breakfast at different countries. I always learn something new by staying with guest families and hosts, they are my best teachers to immerse oneself into the local culture. 
My best cooking recipes have been taught by the locals and the best sightseeing trips organized by the host families.
I am looking forward to meet you and wish you a great stay in Berlin!

name: Attractive Room with private bath
summary: The apartment is lokated in Berlin's "Neukölln" district in a typical Berlin house  - 3 minutes walk to the subway station.
space: Our guest room with the "queen size bed"  (1,40 / 2,00 m - orthopedic mattress and slatted frame) is perfect for any body who wants to save a little bit of money but not compromise their comfort.  The 25 sq.m. room has a balcony and a private bathroom. The bathroom is outside of the bedroom (accessible from the corridor) with shower. If required, another bed can be placed  for a third person. Every morning you get a good breakfast with fresh bread from the bakery and home made jam. You can have a cappuccino, espresso, filter coffee, latte macchiato, or tea. Wifi, microwave, fridge,  dishwasher, washing machine and tumble dryer can be used.

name: Lakeside suite in lovely apartment
summary: There are two adjoining rooms available to guests in my spacious and comfortable apartment. You may also use the large shared bathroom, kitchen and living room, which as a fire
description: There are two adjoining rooms available to guests in my spacious and comfortable apartment. You may also use the large shared bathroom, kitchen and living room, which as a fire You may use the large shared bathrooms, living room, kitchen and dining room. During your stay I will be available for questions via mobile phone and during the evening hours. My apartment is situated in the wonderful part of Berlin called "Friedrichshagen". This is home to the largest lake in Berlin - the Müggelsee, and is perfect for swimming in during the long hot summer months or ice- skating during the winter. In the autumn one can go for long, relaxing walks or shopping in the Bölsche street, which has various cosy cafés and restaurants. The tram line 60 is in 2 minutes of walking distance and takes one to the train station Friedrichshagen in 5 minutes. The main train line is the S3 which takes 15 minutes to Ostkreuz and from there it is only another 10 to the Alexanderplatz.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the famous district Schöneberg between U stations Wittenbergplatz and Nollendorfplatz. In the roaring 1920s, Schöneberg was the neighbourhood of artists and musicians of Berlin. The neighbourhood around Nollendorfplatz in particular was known for elaborate parties and a casual lifestyle. To this day, modern clubs like Goya build on the atmosphere of that time. Winterfeldplatz, which hosts the city's largest food market on Wednesdays and Saturdays, lies directly to the south. Around the square and on nearby side streets, there are plenty of cafes and bars. Another Place of interest is Schöneberg town hall. After the division of Germany, it was the political centre of West Berlin. This is where Kennedy uttered the famous words, 'ich bin ein Berliner'. To the south of the town hall, the long Rudolf-Wilde park is a good option for a leisurely stroll. Schöneberg has a good connection to the neighbouring districts. The U-Bahn lines U1, U2, U3, U4 and U7 go through
notes: Marlene Dietrich lived in this original Berlin house from 1894 and the owner of this apartment is a famous Danish musician. Please note! This is not an apartment but a guest room where You have Your own private en suite bathroom and sunroof terrace. The kitchen and the dining room You have to share with Your host. 5th Floor NO elevator!
transit: 100 meter to bus to Bahnhof Zoo and Alexanderplatz and nearest subway stations Wittenbergplatz and Nollendorfplatz.
access: Access to kitchen and dining room, washing machine and dryer, hairdryer, iron and ironing board and extra towels. Bedlinen and towels are provided.
interaction: We will be happy to help You with information about tourist attractions, good restaurants, bars, clubs and even guided tours on bikes and of course local maps and touristinfos.
house_rules: Smoking only on sunroof terrace. As we are under very strict Copyright laws in Germany we are held responsible for your Internet usage. By booking this guest room You confirm that whilst using the Internet connection You will not use any filesharing sites, programs or software (such as Megaupload, Rapidshare, Torrenz, 4share and others), and will not down- or uppload any music, movies or any other commercial or artistic content that is protected by the German Copyright Laws. You will be hold responsible for any violation of German Copyright Laws.

host_about: American writer living in Berlin for the past 17 years and the past 12 years in this apartment with my husband (artist) and daughter (5 years old) located in the heart of Berlin Mitte, minutes away from Museum Island and the culinary delights of Torstrasse, all local-owned restaurants: French, Thai, Syrian, Vegan, and great small (affordable!) organic grocery stores a stone's throw away!
